{{cpp/title|undeclare_no_pointers}}
{{cpp/memory/navbar}}
{{ddcl|header=memory|since=c++11|removed=c++23|
void undeclare_no_pointers( char *p, std::size_t n );
}}

Unregisters a range earlier registered with {{c|std::declare_no_pointers()}}.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|p|pointer to the beginning of the range previously registered with {{lc|std::declare_no_pointers}}}}
{{par|n|the number of bytes in the range, same value as previously used with {{lc|std::declare_no_pointers}}}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
(none)

===Exceptions===
Throws nothing.

===See also===
{{dsc begin}}
{{dsc inc|cpp/memory/gc/dsc declare_no_pointers}}
{{dsc end}}
